title: Ticket #1206: auto cluster (aka significant) attributes not recursive
description:
When the job requirements refers to a job attribute that is itself an expression, the attributes referenced in this expression are not added to the auto cluster attributes.

This is fixed in 7.5.1 as a side-effect of new classads, but it remains broken in the stable series.

Here is an example submit file that produces the problem: 

+MyRequirements = MyAttribute
+MyAttribute = false
Requirements = MyRequirements
executable = /bin/sleep
arguments = 3600
queue

This produces the following auto clusters. Note the absence of MyAttribute. 

AutoClusterAttrs = "JobUniverse,LastCheckpointPlatform,NumCkpts,MyRequirements,DiskUsage,ImageSize,FileSystemDomain,Requirements,NiceUser,ConcurrencyLimits"

This problem was observed by a user on condor-users. See the thread with the title "Schedd & Negotiator not considering all jobs in the queue for scheduling".
